author: COMSOL
description:
During the beer fermentation process, alcohol, carbon dioxide and various flavors are formed when sugars are consumed by yeast.

In this example, the fermentation process is first modeled in a perfectly mixed tank, using the Reaction Engineering interface. In the next step, a space-dependent tank model is set up, accounting for mass transfer, heat transfer, and natural convection.

The model in this example can be used to optimize the beer fermenting process, and improve the taste of your beer. The model allows you to study the effect of for example initial sugar content, temperature, and yeast type on the fermentation process.
label: beer_fermentation.mph
name: root

title: Fermentation in Beer Brewing
